intro: Pitumba guyannensis, commonly known as the Guyana pitumba, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near riverbanks. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
